intro: Calandrinia sericea var. uspallatensis, commonly known as the Usalatensis sandmat, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, often during the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
